level.heading: Systems revenues; adjustment of surcharge.
level.text: ยง 11-2346 Systems revenues; adjustment of surcharge. (a) All surcharge monies remitted to the city of New York by a wireless communications service supplier shall be expended only upon authorization of the council and only for payment of system costs or other costs associated with the design, construction, operation, maintenance, and administration of public safety communications networks serving the city of New York. The finance commissioner and the director of the office of management and budget shall separately account for and keep adequate books and records of the amount and source of all such monies and of the amount and object or purpose of all expenditures thereof. (b) If, at the end of any fiscal year, the total amount of all such monies exceeds the amount necessary for payment of the above mentioned costs in such fiscal year, such excess shall be reserved and carried over for the payment of those costs in the following fiscal year.
